quest.name: Moegramm Had a Little Lamb
journal: Moegramm has been losing sleep over his sheep.
The wool from Moegramm's sheep lacks its former luster, and won't fetch a fair price at market. The shepherd Chartain should know how to make the sheep shine again.
Chartain attributes the lackluster fleece to lice, and attributes the lice to a lack of farmhands to help with brushing. Delouse three shaggy sheep with the lice comb.
Inform Moegramm that his shaggy sheep now have a sheepy sheen.
Moegramm is grateful you brushed up his wool for market. It would have been a shame to make mutton of the sheep when he seems so...attached.
objectives: Use the lice comb on the shaggy sheep.

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: They call me the Stead shepherd, but all three kinds of livestock we breed here fall under my crook. Nevertheless, sheep remain my first love, my one true passion.

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: So you can imagine my dismay at finding my flock in frumpy fleece! I can't very well take worn-out wool to market. A sheep with no shine is good for nothing but mutton!

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: But where there's wool, there's a way! See what Chartain has to say.

dialogue.name: CHARTAIN
dialogue.text: Moegramm had some little lambs whose fleece was white as snow. But everywhere the little lambs went, lice were sure to go. Now we're stuck with lousy sheep.

dialogue.name: CHARTAIN
dialogue.text: In the time it takes me to brush one clean, the lice spread to two more. I just can't keep up with them by myself!

dialogue.name: CHARTAIN
dialogue.text: If you could brush three shaggy sheep for me, we might be able to wipe out the infestation altogether.

dialogue.name: CHARTAIN
dialogue.text: Let Moegramm know his sheep are in shipshape once you've finished.

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: For an adventurer, you certainly know how to wield a lice comb!

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: As I'm sure you have found, sheep are delicate souls that require delicate care. Truly wonderful wool requires time, love, and tenderness.

dialogue.name: MOEGRAMM
dialogue.text: You must caress their coats ever so gently, listen to their soft bleating in your ear, feel the warmth of their breath on your neck...
